title: How much does it cost to protect your asset?
question: How much does it cost to hire a lawyer to protect your assets and do a trust?
answers:
It all really depends on what you mean by "protect your assets." What are the assets and what are you protecting them from? Protecting your house from probate is a simple matter. Protecting your personal assets from your business debts is a little more complicated. Then, protecting your personal assets from your own personal creditors is very complex.

A $1,000 trust will not protect anything, unless your only goal is to avoid probate.

When the goal is true asset protection - i.e. protecting your assets from your own future creditors - it is very expensive. I like to use the Three Little Pigs as an analogy. Asset protection can be built with hay, sticks and bricks. You can get hay for about $5,000 or so. Sticks cost $10,000 to $15,000, and bricks cost $25,000 to $75,000.

I know these numbers are very high, but if your assets are at risk, then it is money well spent.

Last thing. This is an area with an enormous amount of misinformation online. Be careful.

Fees for Trust drafting vary greatly depending on the complexity of the situation , if its a single or joint marital trust, and the experience of the lawyer. Usually, more than document is prepared (Trust, Pour Over Will; Power of Attorney; Health Care Power of Attorney etc).

A single, simple trust with few assets or minimal estate planning and tax planning is as low as $500 at bargain prices. Generally, a thorough estate planning package starts at $5,000.00 and up.

Revocable trusts do not provide the asset protection that a irrevocable trusts provides but it has less drawbacks (you can amend or revoke it) but likewise creditors expect you should revoke it and pay them whereas a irrevocable trust (not common) is similar to a gift in that you cannot reach it.

Prices vary depending upon the quality and credentials of the attorney as well as the complexity of the trust assets.

For a simple trust I generally refer my clients to an attorney who charges between $995 and $1295 for a trust.
